resources.string: Overview
Chanic Panic is a turn-based card battle game.
Sharing the same deck, players set up defenses and then proceed to attack opponents.
A player or team wins when all opponents have been eliminated.
The Deck

Card Suits:

Hearts ♥: These are health. If a player’s health becomes zero or less because of an attack, that player is eliminated.

Diamonds ♦: These are shields. A player must destroy all Diamonds controlled by an opponent before being able to attack the Hearts with full power.

Spades ♠: These are weapons. They are used to attack and destroy Diamonds and Hearts.

Clubs ♣: These are resources. They are used to draw and play more cards.

Card Classifications:

Each type of card is classified as one of the following:

Utility Cards (Hearts, Diamonds, Spades): These are played on the Board.

Resource Cards (Clubs): These are played on the Discard Pile.

Card Attributes:

Value: Each card has a value equal to the number on it. Values range from 1 to 10.

Cost: This only applies to Utility Cards. A card costs a number of Points to play equal to its value.
The Turn

Each turn is structured as follows:

		1. Draw Phase
		2. Standby Phase
		3. Point Phase
		4. Club Phase

Draw Phase: On the first turn a player draws 5 cards. On all subsequent turns a player draws 1 card.

Standby Phase: This is a time for abilities to activate.

Point Phase: A player starts each turn with 12 Points. During this time, players pay points to play Utility Cards. Points do not carry over from turn to turn.

Club Phase: This begins as soon as a player plays a Club. At this time, Points are lost and the properties of Clubs come into effect.
The Board
Each player has a board with rows of the 3 Utility Cards (Hearts, Diamonds, and Spades).
Up to 3 cards of the same suit can be on the board at a time.
Once on the board, cards cannot be returned to the hand.
Playing Cards
Utility Cards: These are played by paying the appropriate number of points or by the effect of a Club as long as 3 cards of the respective suit are not already on the board.
Spades cannot be played until the 3rd round.

Resource Cards: Clubs: These may be played at any time during the Point Phase and thereby end it.

 When a Club is played:

		If it has a value of 1–5: Draw 2 cards.
		If it has a value of 6–10: Draw 1 card.

Then 1 card with a value less than or equal to the value of the Club may be played.
Attacking
Attacks are the way Diamonds and Hearts are destroyed and players are eliminated.
Only Spades on the board may be used to attack.
Players may not attack until the 3rd round.
A player may attack at any time during the Point or Club Phase.
A player may not attack without destroying at least 1 Diamond or Heart but is never required to attack.
To destroy a card, any combination of spade values must be greater than or equal to any combination of an opponent’s Diamond or Heart values.
All opponent Diamonds must be destroyed before attacking the Hearts with full power.

Shield Bypassing: This is a special attack that becomes available starting the 4th round. A player may ignore an opponent’s Diamonds and attack the Hearts directly. However, the attack power is cut in half and rounded down if necessary.
After an attack, all Spades used, and all Diamond and Hearts destroyed are discarded.
Abilities
Each player has the following abilities:
Trader: Discard 2 cards: Draw 1 card.
Ally (when playing in teams): Once per turn: Give a card from your hand to your next teammate.
Additional Rules
Full Hand: A player may never hold more than 8 cards. Cards are not drawn or added to the hand if it contains 8 cards.
When the deck runs out, the discard pile is shuffled and becomes the deck.
Interface Essentials

Playing Cards:

Tap on a card in your hand to select/deselect it.

Tap Confirm to play it.

Viewing Boards:

Swipe or press the right and left arrows to switch board views.

Press the board info in the bottom left corner to bring up a list of all the boards and quickly jump to one.

Attacking:

Switch to the board of an opponent.

If it is the 3rd round or later, an Attack button will appear between the End Turn and Confirm buttons.

Press Attack. 

The board will change to show your Spades.

Tap your Spades to choose which ones you want to use to attack.

The Diamonds/Hearts that would be destroyed based on your selection will be highlighted.

The info at the top of the screen will tell you the attack’s power, damage, and efficiency.

Press Confirm to carry out the attack.
Presence
Presence is an optional Chanic Panic Mechanic that adds a secondary win condition to the game.
During the Standby Phase, the turn player gains 2 Presence for each card controlled.
Presence accumulates over the course of the game.
A player wins when 200 Presence is obtained.
Still Confused?
See chanicpanic.com/app/reference for more detailed instructions.\n\nOr, send your questions to support@chanicpanic.com.
